benchmark_details.name: Finance MATH
benchmark_details.overview: Finance MATH is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLMsâ€™ capabilities in solving knowledge-intensive math reasoning problems specifically in finance. It includes 1,200 problems that require college-level knowledge in finance and incorporates both textual and tabular data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess LLMs' abilities in knowledge-intensive math reasoning in the finance domain.

data.source: Expert-annotated questions created from a knowledge bank of financial terms.
data.annotation: Annotated by experts with detailed solution references.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the correct answers provided by LLMs compared to the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy measures how well LLMs solve knowledge-intensive math problems in finance, with a focus on comparing performance against human expert benchmarks.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing model, GPT-4o, achieves 60.9% accuracy.
methodology.validation: Comprehensive validation protocols involving multiple annotators to ensure quality.
